Former pope returned to homeland to see sick sibling

Benedict XVI back in the Vatican after visiting brother

Former pope Benedict XVI returned to the Vatican on Monday after a five-day trip to Germany to visit his sick, 96-year-old brother, Georg. The pope emeritus flew back to Rome on a Falcon 900 from Munich.

Govts must intervene to stop scourge says Francis

Child labour is slavery says Pope

Child labour is slavery, Pope Francis said Wednesday urging governments to intervene to stop this "scourge". He said "it deprives boys and girls of their childhood".

Coronavirus: Pope Francis sets up 'work dignity' fund in Rome

Pope Francis on Tuesday set up what he called a 'work dignity' fund in Rome. As bishop of Rome, he said, he had decided to institute the fund, dubbed "Jesus Divine Worker".
